When taken to Tp Link service centre, they said the number on the box has been scratched and it is not genuine. I want to know what step can amazon take on this instance as i cant get my router repaired and the return policy was just 1 day after purchase.***Okay to start the review, I have been using Netgear N150 router for last 4 years and this time I needed a new router since devices were increasing in my house (Google chromecast, Google Home, Laptops and mobiles). My netgear router was not able to cover even a 2-BHK and when a lot of devices were connecting at the same time, the chromecast and google home stops working which was such a pain when one person wants to listen music or to steam videos on TV.So, I finally decided and after reading a lot of reviews of different products zeroed on to this product - TP-LINK TL-WR940N Wireless-N450 Home Router (Mentioning full name since it seems amazon mixes all the reviews of different products of one brand into one list).Pros -1- The wifi range is good and comfortably covers my 2 BHK house, even after going some more distance away from home(around 20 meters) I get the range.2- Able to connect multiple devices (MIMO tech works) (including chromecast, google home) without interruptions.3- Can easily use this router as wifi range extender as well. A big plus for big homes.4- T Plink app works fine with the router and you can easily customize settings there.5- A RJ-45 cable comes inside the box, helps connecting my ACT broadband connection to laptop when there is no power.Cons-1. I got used to mutiple lights on my Netgear router, but his one has just single light. Turns blue if wifi connection is working fine and turns yellow if ISP connections breaks. Not a big concern. Just need to get used to it.***

So after a year it started lagging cuz I was playing very heavy games. So then the new Mid Range phones were Realme 2 Pro and Honor 8X. These were under by budget. I wanted to buy Realme 2 Pro as it had 8gb ram and good camera. But then after watching a lot of youtube videos, I thought I should go for honor 8x. And so I bought this. When I opened the package and took honor 8x on my hand, it felt premium. But then when I started downloading apps from playstore, it wasn't using my data to download it, just wifi. I had to cancel all installs and download it at my office Wifi. 2)The next thing is that, the phone is really really HEAVY. I was using it with my left hand while I was sleeping, and literally after 5 minutes my wrist started to pain. But what if it falls on my head or mouth, like all the phones do? While using it lying on the bed? I am going to get a serious injury. In the Tech pages too, they have mentioned this as a Con.3)Front Camera:  The Camera really SUCKs. The back camera is okay, but it's saturation is very high especially for Red, Green and Blue. The camera has depth, but it's of no use as the Camera Saturation is high. Don't talk about the front camera, I use my sister's Realme 1 for taking selfies...4) PUBG: So when I open the game, it has loading error, says 'Could not connect to server' seems to be network issue, but the Realme 1 loads properly without any issues, even when both the phones are in the SAME room. Also the map in Realme 1 loads faster, maybe because it has 6 GB ram and the one I am using has 4 GB. I should have gone for Realme 2 pro which had 6 Gb for lesser Price.I wished I had ordered Realme 2 pro. Too lazy to return then get refund and all. But if you need a light phone, go for Realme 2 pro. it's light, games don't lag and also has a good battery. I'm just somewhat sad.  And the Customer Service of HONOR is so pathetic, they don't know what I am asking and COPY PASTE wrong info in the chat, I once had to talk with a Supervisor to get the correct information.***

cust_review: ●The special feature which makes it's different in the segment or even some flagship models is it's Camera.The Camera is amazing.●I was using Mi A1 and that was also a perfect phone even better than Mi A2 in terms of Screen, Sound and Battery Quality. But still, I upgraded to just because of it's Camera.●The phone is too sleek and gives a premium look (If you don't put cover on it)●There is no joke in terms of dual camera setup what are generally other manufacturers are doing. (Most of the company are providing just 2MP setup in the name of dual camera, which is not too much effective and just for the name of dual camera)●Stock Android is too fast even 3 GB RAM is sufficient for this chipset unless you play games on mobiles.●Enduring Battery Backup is 24-30 hours depending on your usage.●Selfie Camera is class across the all leading mobiles.●Screen & Sound Quality is just average and not so good, If I compare to MiA1● Call Voice clarity and Signal reception is too good just like the Mi A1●And yes you have to compromise with battery backup, Audio Jack and no expandable storage option. There is some sensors issues too what I am noticing (may be resolved in OTA updates)But still, searching a Camera centric phone under 20K with very fast processor with uncustomized Andorid (Stock Andorid) then your search comes to an ends on this device.Go for it surely***Overall rating 3.5/5 cant give 3.5 stars so 3* rating.I bought this in the Amazon sale for 13.5k so for that price its a very competent smartphone but it has some major drawbacks at regular MRP that stops it from being a perfect mid ranger. Drawbacks mentioned under cons.Now you might be thinking by reading the previous statement that aha, we know what they are, but no reader they are not what you think. I am not taking about the missing micro sd slot or headphone jack.Vs Nokia 7 PlusI bought this phone because someone stole my Nokia 7 plus. I had lived with a same spec phone for 5 months and let me tell you the A2 is a way better phone in terms of performance and smoothness. The 7 plus from day 1 always stuttered, froze and had janky animations. Even after multiple updates the 7 plus was not a smooth performer. So performance is a plus. The A2 performs as a SD660 phone should.7 plus had better battery life. Yes 7 plus has a bigger battery but battery drain under load was also less on the 7 plus.Phone supports Quick charge and I have the qc3.0 charger so I can take advantage of fast charging feature. Standard supplied charger is a 10W charger. Even with screen on the fast charging keeps working unlike the 7 Plus and some other phones.Build quality on Nokia 7 plus is better but that also costs more. A2 is well built as well but the Nokia is better. A2 is slippery AF, the back is super smooth.Display is better on A2 since it has no jelly effect(which the Nokia had) and the calibration is a waaaaayyy better compared to Nokia 7 plus  which has an awfully high white point and terrible RBG & grayscale performance. Brightness is about the same.Cons1) A2 has adequate battery life. 5PM topups are required if you use all the features of the phone. This is not an all day phone.2) No widewine L1(has L3) certification means no FHD Netflix and Amazon prime. You are stuck at 480p. This is really bad, my 5 year old Xperia Z3 has Widewine L1. This is just penny pinching where a manufacturer should not penny pinch.3) No LDAC support even though this is an Oreo feature. I tested using Sony wireless headphones which support LDAC.4) Pathetic vibration motor.5) No Hybrid sim slot. For 2 sim users like me this is not a deal breaker since we know what we are getting into but no micro sd slot is a turnoff for many.6) No IP certification. Yes I know its a mid range phone & I'm not expecting IP68 but IP54(Splash proof) IMHO is a must on all phones above 10K.7) Only USB 2.0 support. its 2018 manufacturers 3.0 only cost 15-20 cents more to implement.8) Does not support Pixel camera mod, Nokia 7 plus supported it.Pros:Android OneSnappy performance, its nearly SD835 fast. I tested using PC mark and the Work 2.0 scores are within 10%. My other phone has SD835.QC4.0 support and backwards compatible with all versions of Quick Charge.USB Type C.Above average cameras, competent for the segment.Conclusion:When you buy a smartphone you are looking for the complete experience and this phone does not provide that in a few key areas like the lack of widewine L1 and LDAC support. I have been aware of widewine L1 b4 the pocofone controversy because unlike Netflix, Amazon prime supports only a handful of Samsung, Apple & Sony devices for 1080p & HDR playback and even if your phone has widewine L1 unless the phone is Amazon certified you will not get 1080p playback in the prime video app. So the first thing I tested was the DRM info and this phone lacks widewine L1 which is a bummer.I can understand the lack of aptx since that requires additional royalties to qualcomm and the A2 being a midranger I can see why Xiaomi chose to not provide aptX or aptx HD but no LDAC, come on there is no headphone jack on this device so the least Xiaomi could have done is enable a feature that is baked into the Oreo OS to at least provide the best BT audio codec.Considering the sharp fall is data rates and the rise of streaming video services which a ton of users use its baffling that Xiaomi chose to omit 2 really important features which are so important to really enjoy streaming servicesThis is a phone that has some very strong points like, Android One, fast smooth performance, support for QC4.0 but then has huge drawbacks which I have mentioned previously along with the missing 3.5mm jack and no hybrid slot support.Who should buy the Mi A2: Someone who is looking for a fast snappy performing phone and values stock Android and 2 years of guaranteed updates over features like 3.5mm jack, SD card slot and marathon (7-8 hr SOT) battery run times..***Pros:- all good, big screen, really good camera, looksCons:- the type c connector provided along is not working. I have tried two different brand headphone but the phone is not detecting it so it could be faulty type c connector? Or is it specific to Mi headphones only?? Because under the headphone setting it shows MI headphones option only.Can anyone help?***Awesome productPros:Faster chipsetGood camerasValue for moneyStock Android softwareQuick Charge 4+ supportGood displaysuperb selfie cameraCons:No 3.5mm audio jacklacks a microSD card slotAverage battery lifeMissing NotchThanks Amazon & Faster n Guarantee delivery.***It is an awesome phone..  this is for those who wants a better camera.. it's camera is truly amazing.specially the manual mode.. it's speaker is tooo loud. Although having 3010 battery it's capable to last 5hours of use online and 10hours of offline use..Awesome phone 👌***nothing great, other than camera, facing a major problem while calling screen is not getting off and causing call drop, going call on mute, flash getting on etc.***Useless model, I purchased based on xioami quality. Within one month the phone dead. I am running to service centre, got replacement. It's working. Appreciate their services***Battery draining very fast. Max it come for 12hrs.I don't recommend to buy this model.***

cust_review: Finally I found the solution of phone heating during map use on my phone. So, it is comfortable for long usage.When you turn it on or off, it also plays voice notification to let you know if it is turned on or off. For pairing it with a new device, you need to understand one important thing. When you turn it on, you need to keep pressing the power button until the LED notification starts blinking fast. This puts the earphone in the pairing mode and voice notification says “Pairing mode”.When it comes to sound clarity, it impresses. I tested it with different kinds of tracks and it was good. It is loud, so the noise of the surrounding will not affect you when you are using it. Xiaomi claims dynamic bass feature that didn’t impress. The bass is average, so it will disappoint you if you love bass heavy music. Same goes with treble. It means this earphone is not for you if you are looking for good music experience, then you will also have to increase your budget because not much options are there in this price segment. Product_name: Tarkan [Rubberized] Air Vent Universal Car Mount Holder for All Mobile Phones [4 Inch to 6.3 Inch]
prod_des: The most advanced and most popular car mount at amazing price. Offer limited.
feature: Compatible with all types of air vent (thin or thick, circular or horizontal) with it's advanced rubber grip.Rubberised holder sides ensure no damage or scratch to your phoneRound Edge and Non-Slip Grip to hold your phone tightly even in case of high bumps or turbulence.Fits all smartphones upto 6.3 inch screen size including iPhone, Samsung, Lenovo, Moto, Xiaomi, etcLightweight, pocket friendly, portable design. Can be used in any car, anytime unlike traditional mounts which are fixed.
cust_review: Finally I found the solution of phone heating during map use on my phone. In case if you use a normal wind shield vacuum holder, the Phone could caught with excessive heat, right below the Sun & in case if your GPS is on.Now I keep my phone over AC vent onto this holder & AC chilled wind keeps it ice chilled. However, do not forget to wrap the phone with your hanky or a sweatproof cloth, once you come out of car to rinse out of sudden moisture generation over phone body.Looks so cute too. A must have for tourers & drivers.***Decent build Quality. Grip is good - it never slipped out of Air vents over the last 6 months of use. However, the phones tend to be in line of very cold AC air and the battery starts losing  charge at an alarming speed. Tried various phones with different battery life and age of battery - but it loses battery at atleast 4 to 7 times faster when placed in the air vent holder.***Okay, I have bought this product twice in a duration of 3-4 months. Because I lost the first one when my vehicle got serviced.It is not easy to use, take effort to put inside vents also opening it and putting your mobile is slightly difficult. I still bought it second time because it gives me flexibility to remove from one side and put to another (though mobile blocks vents as well).Also since it is economical so okay even if it lasts not so long.The main purpose of car mobile holders is that you use navigation, which is only required when you are on not a familiar route. It serves that purpose !***Not good. Takes a lot of effort to push this guy in the vent. Gets bent every new time you try to insert. After couple of weeks the rubber coating wears off and the metal starts showing up. This metal then makes scratch marks on your AC vents. Not worth it guys..You will be really disappointed. I am using Tech sense magnet holders these days, got it in offer. It works like charm.***Good material and tough built. Holds the mobile (mine is a heavy one - Lenovo Vibe P1a) well. Drove in village roads with huge potholes in speed and slow, didn't fall. Only drawback is, the fixing clip being short and wide in diameter, does not go much inside the fins and tends to stay out. The manufacturer should work on this. Except this, this is a great product.***Quality and finish of the product is good. The grip of the vent holding tongs and the phone holder arms is excellent. I am giving it 3 stars as when the phone is mounted in the holder, it blocks a vent. If you keep the vent open and AC running, then in humid conditions like Mumbai, a lot of condensation gathers on the phone. Otherwise excellent product for the price.***This product is absolutely very useful. Its so simple to attach to the car AC vent and it holds the phone very tightly without any shakes or vibrations.I am loving it from day one. Amazon also delivered this product promptly.***Lock and unlocking mechanisim can be made user friendly have to use two hand for streching and locking the device ... but it of great build quality with rubberized rigit surface.***

Compared to the Android one Xiaomi Mi A2, whose Android Pie takes a whopping 13 GB of space.6) The feel of heft added balances the polycarbonate back compared to metal or glass.7) Not slippery. Only flagship phone that can be used without a case.8) Battery life on par with other flagships.Dislikes1) ugly notch.2) Like all MIUI , Ads are present from the usual pre installed apps. ( There's a xda developer article on how to disable most of these)3) Don't listen to the reviewers who says the liquid cooling system doesn't allow the phone to heat up. THE PHONE DOES HEAT UP.4) MIUI fails on notifications. I wouldn't use any MIUI based phone for my daily driver.5) Setting icon sometimes is hard to tap correctly on the toggle.6) Brightness sometimes gets a bit lackluster.***I've been using it for 2 months now, and so far I'm happy with it. I have repeatedly tried the so called helpline no's 18001031333 no resolution was given another helpline no 18004190373 keep calling this number the line gets connected for tens of minutes and no one answers.In nutshell not expected this type of lemon from panasonic, beware guys before you think this is the same old trustworthy panasonic.***The phone is sleek and perfect for office use. My observations are:It's base need power to use so better to connect to inverter point.Sound is good, only once other person said that his voice is echoing. May be because that time earpiece volume was at max. These are hollow piece so great chance of echo. But on an average its good. +There could be network induced echo.It has 50 contact memory with one number per contact with name (16 character limit, like old mobiles).The phonebook and incoming call list is probably saved in base so you can't see them when no power is available to base / no link between.Looking for call is easy just press left nav key for incoming and outgoing by right key. There is a catch, for incoming it saves time but not for outgoing. Single list for all incoming call and missed calls (20 entries).It have few (or many) ringtones (6 tone and 14 melody). But I like basic one and other feel like old toy tones. Who wants to play jingle bells or london bridge is falling down as ringtone. :-P All melodies are more like a car reverse horn. One can live with tones.Keypad is good and instead of "off" they should given better name to key. Further, 2 separate keys for pause and flash is overkill. I hardly used in 2 decade on any phone.Its not having speaker phone, as its basis cordless phone.You can mount base on the wall.I know some people says its costly but I must say its quality they will get. cust_review: Motorola really deserves a 0 star rating for how well their service centres and customer care manages to dissappoint their customers. However good the product may seem never buy a Motorola product just for the way they treat their customers after purchase. It has been more than 1 year since i have been using this phone and i have been literally fighting with the service centre every now and then. Every single visit of mine to the service centre somehow ends up in a fight and i do find most of my fellow customers either supporting me or starting a fight all by themselves all through the durations of time that i spend there. From my experience i can easily say this is the worst mobile service centre you can find. If you still want to go ahead and buy a Motorola make sure you completely know how to repair your phone or make sure you do know someone who can help. In simple words Motorola SUCKS.***Few highlights after 1 year of usage:-1) Battery: Lasts a day or more. Depends heavily on the usage. Sometimes drains with 4G and draining apps.2) Camera: Expected a bit more from the camera especially the dual lens setup from Moto. It does a decent job but not top notch. Don't expect OnePlus like pictures (obviously) without editing. Selfie camera is good enough though.3) Software: Bad experience here. Motorola management and devs need to up their game because we're getting Android Oreo after almost a year while Motorola promised it in early 2018. Only security patch updates were provided for a 16k phone with other competitors in the market. Software experience is stock though which is very good, no bloatware.4) Gestures: I think the gestures and one button navigation is one of the best features of this smartphone. I use it on a daily basis (gestures only, not a big fan of single button navigation gestures but many people like it).5) Turbo Charger: Very good, provides a great amount of charge in less time. One of the best that I've seen. But the cable plastic end got frayed.6) Display & Design: Top notch for the price. One of the best in this price segment. However, the design gets wasted if you put it in a case :)7) Rest: Snapdragon 625, 4GB RAM, 64GB Storage, no complaints here. Performance wise its good! (Funny though that Moto G6 has Snapdragon 450 for the same price at launch! What are you doing Moto?).***Don't go for this mobile. Not at all receiving the signal and call quality is very bad. Being a 4gb ram, hanging frequently and low battery. Because of signal problem, battery is draining dramatically. Wast of  money only***Camera is not that much good in low lighting worst performance and the main Problem​ is in wifi issue disconnected randomly over all not worth to buy***I disliked the product. It's overheating while using any app. And super heating while on charging. In fact it's so hot that I can iron my clothes with it. I wondered why Motorola didn't hilight this iron heating portable iron feature in commercial. Also they do not provide you the replacement in customer care center they just keep repairing your brand new phone and will make it refurbished. Don't buy it people. I lost my faith in Motorola Lenovo.***I am writing this review after 10 months. So here I am sharing my personal experiences with this phone:First of all thanks to Amazon for its prompt delivery and thanks to Seller Darshita Electronics for sending this product in good condition.Pros:Build Quality: Very good build qualityPerformance: Performance is very good no lags are experienced till now.Sound Quality: Good but not much loud. I liked it personally.Camera Quality: Good in Outdoor also 4K video recording is bundled.FingerPrint Scanner: Responsive scanner. It detects the finger print quite fast.Battery Backup: Good if you are on Android Nougat. It stays almost one day of heavy usage.TurboCharging: Fast charging is available on this device and it charges quickly.Cons:Camera Quality: Disappointed with image processing from this camera. i can say it was below average. The Dual Camera setup was a disappointment. But soon Motorola had released the camera updates and it improved in great extent. I can say the Dual camera is properly implemented after lot of updates from Motorola. Color reproduction of this camera is a below average it did not process the image if i compare it with Google camera which is installed in my device and also very surprised that images shot with Google camera app are far better than the Motorola's stock camera app as it is using same sensor. Don't know why Motorola is not working on the camera quality.Camera Bumps: As we know that Camera Bumps are bit outwards on this model so there is a chance for scratches on the camera glass so better to have a protective back cover with camera protection.Regular Updates: Updates are not in the list of Motorola as they are focusing on their new models so ignoring the previous models. I have recently got the Oreo updates after so much waiting. Very poor service when it comes to the updates from Motorola.Battery backup: Battery backup deteriorates after upgrading to Android Oreo. I have noticed the next day i have to charge two time a day after upgrading. Now waiting for the next update hope this will be fixed in next update.Final Verdict: If you are a camera freak and expecting for some great shots then this phone will give you an average quality so better think for other options available in the market. But if you are an average user with some budget restrictions then go for it.The above said are my experiences with this phone and my overall rating for this phone will be 3.5.***G5s plus is best camera is really superb,sound is fantastic, battery performance is also good m doing after 2weeks m posting this review go for g5s plus it's buttry smooth low lights pictures are also good daylight pic are really amazing what Moto need to imporve is front camera with portrait mode nothing else  m really happy with my g5s plus sry for not more pictures due to some problem with photos that's y I upload a single pic about battery and that's amazing superb battery backup thank you Amazon***

These arr the best you can get if you want Durability. But if you want better audio quality , go for the JBL ones. I posted because i felt i should share this information as i have used all of the earphones in this price range.Update :7 months and they are still working great . I bought 2 pairs some time in September 2018. I still stand by my words as mentioned above. The headphones are now fully burned to give optimum sound. Still my go to pair of headphones as an alternative to full headset.***This earphn is super.There is no extra bass.You will enjoy smooth bass and a clear music according to the song.***This is not as per value and the expectations. prod_des: Honor View 20 is powered by the flagship Kirin 980 AI Chipset which is the world’s first chipset manufactured with 7nm process and have dual NPU which significantly improves the performance and energy efficiency. It has the world’s first 48MP AI and TOF 3D camera, with an upgraded AI capability which can recognize over 1,500 scenarios in more than 60 categories and a 25MP AI in-screen front camera. it comes in two variants, 6GB RAM + 128GB storage and 8GB RAM + 256GB storage. Honor View 20 has a 4000mAh battery with super charge (5V 4A). It supports a 16.25cm FHD+ Full View display with 91 percent screen to body ratio. It has Android 9.0, with the latest Magic UI 2.0 on top. Honor View 20 comes with GPU Turbo 2.0 and The NINE water cooling technology giving you a faster, smoother and more seamless experience.

cust_review: Fantastic phone what a performance i love it.***Disclaimer : Bought Honor View20 purely for the camera. (i cant comment much on the gaming performance)Read / watched quite a lot of reviews and made my decision over One Plus 6T.Rear Camera :Crisp and clear image and hardly no difference with 1+. 4K videos and full HD videos, background blur in the video, are cool features.Night mode is amazing., better than 1+48MP AI camera is just fine, its not Wow.  You expect a lot more for that number. It matches ip with 1+Slow motion is only @ 720p.. 1+ is better off.Front cam pics are good, but videos are more stable in 1+ as V20 does not have image stabilization for front cam., hope there's a firmware update soon.Too many options available for photos and videos., You need to explore hands on to get the real feel of all the features.Personally i prefer the punch hole over the water drop notch. The screen looks bigger and the notch does not bother much.Needless to say about the design of V20, definitely gives a premium than the 1+Headphone jack, IR sensor, Notification lights are cool features to have (all 3 are missing in 1+)Lcd IPS display in V20 vs Amoled display in the 1+, which means though the battery might look bigger in number on the V20.,  1+ will last a few hours more.. The display in V20 is still good.User interface is better in the 1+ and honor's magic UI is way behind.The silicon back case is perfect.Overall not much of a difference between Honor V20 and 1+6T in terms of performance, display, battery or camera.Its good to hold a top notch, latest phone with first in class latest specs. Go for it. I'm happy with the phone.***It's nor worth for money.. Camera is very normal as 12MP only. Dunno in what basis they are saying it as 48MP. It's not going zoomin dept as oneplus 6T goes. Indoor pics are not that good. Even nyt shoot ll be better in vivo or oppo than this one. If anyone is going to get this mob just for a cam don't buy. It's my suggestion. Battery is gud but not as moto or one plus provides. Display is gud.***this is my initial review will post again after few weeks1) Display (6/10)- yes its a punch hole but panel quality is average2) Selfie camera(6/10) - images are soft when taken indoors.3) Rear Camera (7.5/10) - good photos in good light, hit and a miss affair in an indoor/low light situation.4) Performance (9/10) is very good , no lags.5) There is a vibration felt in the phone when talking to someone, feels hollow inside.6) Sound output via earphones is good but not great7) Speakers are average.30k would have justified the cost for this phone but 38k its not worth.***Honor / Huawei made another gorgeous look handset in 2019.I received the same yesterday, so few points I can elaborate today, but I definitely revise my review soon after a month or two.1. Look is stunning2. Rear Camera is awesome though its hard to understand that what 3D TOF actually is. But 48Megapixels are more than enough, you can ZOOM how much you want but PPI (Pixel per inches) will never fetch3. Front Camera - Same as above, (Do not forget to OFF beauty plus button) front camera is also stunning.4. Turbo/Super charging. I charged it only 20 minutes yesterday and battery goes 5% t0 76%.5. Size is almost same as Honor 9i was. Though molded screen is better than that.6 NO heat till yet, though phone was hot when the delivery agent bring it to me but that because he took the box in sunlight before delivering (In his back pack and he was on two wheeler)7. Sound is good, not too awesome.And You can not add external microphone in honor 20 while recording a video. But in other androids, you can add the same easily.Overall phone is better than Iphone ;) . Revised reviewThanksSiddharth Arora***Used it for more than 2 hours, the display looks great with punch hole technology. Battery life and camera are things which are yet to be tested by me. I will update this review after 2 days of use.So far so good***Better then 6t***Just now i got mobile... Excellent performance,  sounds and camera are awesome. I will post after usage of other spec.***

Its a 6GB ram phone but does not act like 6GB RAM phone. Big files like pubg, asphalt lags alot. Auto shutdown or hang happens quite offen. Internet, wifi, Bluetooth connections are all the worst. Screen is too bad. You cannot play games like pubg as You can see the spot where your thumbs touch after 2 months and it is permanent. Old moto phone i played for more than 1 year with no problem on the screen. SCREEN has too many reflections. Little light presence can cause shiny reflection on your screen so you are not able to play, watch movie. In order to avoid this you have to either switch off the light or set the brightness high. You cannot even get a good fit phone cover, back case. PRICE IS HIGH. DO NOT GO FOR THIS, MOTO, CHECK OUT OTHER MODEL. till now.  I tell you: THIS IS NO MOTO PHONE.***Got this on sale with exchange for less than half the retail price. I've owned and used Moto phones before and they're sturdy and reliable; decent performance, decent cameras, decent battery and none of the strange frustrating annoyances you sometimes get with cheaper Android phones. Motorola is one of the very few brands in the mid range that makes near vanilla Android phones- so no bloatware out of the box, no crappy UI or software skin to deal with and fast updates.Battery life should be decent; I'll update this review if it isn't. Screen is sharp and clean and bright; colours not as beautiful as a Pixel or One Plus but good enough. The charging cable is a little short, but it's USB type C so I've plenty of substitutes around the house. It comes bundled with white earphones of surprisingly reasonable quality and 3 pairs of replacement cups.My only complaint is that the phone itself is a little too big and heavy, but nothing you can't get used to. About the same dimensions as a One Plus 5. Overall an excellent phone for the money. Will do 80% of what flagships do and 100% of what most people who buy flagships want from their phones anyway.***It is definitely not a "Bang for the Buck" kinda product. It does feels premium than any other device under 16k. Plus does have a USB Type C. It does lagged a bit on Android Oreo (8) but after Android Pie (9) update it is smooth. The Snapdragon 630 is a bit outdated processor but still does the job with quite ease.Build:Glass with aluminium build. The only thing which bothers me is the Sim Tray! It is so plasticy. But doesn't matter if you don't frequently ejecting and swapping sims.Display:It is not bad.Camera:A good one in the daylight. But great in the low light situation. Supports 4K 30fps Video recording but doesn't have EIS. 1080p 60fps is also available but no EIS there. 1080p 30fps has the EIS.Battery:Great for a 3200Mah Battery. Not outstanding or bad. It does last for a day unless yours is defective. And plus it charges up in less than 1.2Hrs.Performance:It is a SD630 with 6 gigs of ram and apps runs smoothly. Can only play PUBG in lowest settings as default. But if you use GFX Tool can run PUBG on HD settings and 60fps with almost no lag. It'd be butter smooth in 30fps or medium settings.Cons:Everything is not built for everyone. It is a bit slippery due to the glass build. But the Corning Gorilla Glass 3 does a good job against scratches. It is a bit longer than usual competition but the width is good for grabbing in one hand. (BTW I don't recommend it to people with small hands and rough usage). Camera bumb is a little bulgy than usual moto phones, but you can always place it facing upside down. And it helps to protect it against scratches.Conclusion:It is has a good build but a older processor. If you are looking for a premium looking phone for under 16k it does it well. You can play pubg on low to hd settings without any issues. The major issue with this phone was its pricing (23k @ launch) and it got many criticism due to the price to performance ratio. But now (2-02-2019) it is under 16k. For this price it is a good choice but definitely not for everyone product.***Awesome phone with all the features on offer.Pros -PerformanceBatteryDisplayLooksSounds mind-blowingCamera average, but good in this price rangeConsFront firing single speaker is not too loud and it is not too low either.Camera bump could have been avoidedVibration is not too good to be noticed, one may end up losing calls or notification due to low sound and vibrationOverall it is a good and sturdy product.***There was a problem in this phone but at the day I can't get replacement***

Super smart phone. Friendly features.i play high memory consumption games but never hangs ... I am very happy.1. Not but the list -battery consumption patterns when we use mobile data is very high. Drain very fast.***Ordered the phone in the first sale to put a review on our website. Here’s a detailed review with pros cons and ratings. Few camera samples are also included.Pros:+ Good Build+ Nice Display+ Powerful Chipset+ Lag Free Performance+ No Heating+ 2 Day Battery+ Good Front and Rear Cameras+ Quick Charge 3.0 Supported+ Case Provided in the boxCons:- No Dedicated MicroSD Slot- No Type-C PortRatings:Design: 8/10Display: 8/10Battery: 10/10Back Camera: 9/10Front Camera: 8/10Processor: 9/10Call Quality: 9/10Face Unlock and Fingerprint: 9/10Sound from Speakers: 9/10Sound from Earphones: 8/10Pricing: 9/10Overall Rating: 9/10Detailed Review:Here’s what you get inside the box:1. Handset2. Charger (5V 2A)3. USB charging cable4. Sim ejector pin5. Translucent CaseDesign:The design of Note 6 Pro same as that of Note 5 Pro so nothing special here. The build quality is decent, and phone feels good in hand. Rating 8/10.Display:The display on the front is a Full HD 6.3-inch notch display with 19:9 aspect ratio. The display is sharp and bright with good viewing angles and colors. It is covered with a 2.5D glass which gives it a premium look. The notch on the top is big and there is a significant chin at the bottom as well. I think Xiaomi could have done a bit better here. Big notches mean less space for notification icons so that’s not great. Rating 8/10.Battery:The phone comes with a 4000 mAh battery which is also same as Note 5 Pro. So, with moderate usage you can expect a battery backup of 2 days on a single charge. One nice improvement in Note 6 Pro is that Quick Charge 3.0 is available now. The phone does not come with a fast charger though and you need to buy it separately. Rating 10/10.Audio:The speaker at the bottom of the device is surprisingly very loud and clear. The audio via the earphone is average if you don’t tweak the settings. So, I’d recommend going into setting and use the equalizer and sound enhancer options to improve audio via 3.5mm jack. Rating 8.5/10.Performance:The Note 6 Pro runs on same Snapdragon 636. Snapdragon 636 is a good midrange chipset with performance and efficiency, so we have no complaints. App opens and close fast. Gaming is smooth as well. If you use a ton of apps then maybe go for the 6GB RAM variant. Rating 8.5/10.Security:Both fingerprint sensor and face unlock work well on the Redmi Note 6 Pro. Fingerprint sensor is quick and accurate while the Face unlock takes a bit of time (less than a second) to unlock the device. Face unlock is not that secure and can unlocked by another person so don’t use it if you have something on your phone that should not be seen by others. Rating 9/10.Pricing:The pricing of Note 6 Pro was a bit of a surprise because Note 5 Pro price was increased from 13999 to 14999 and the Note 6 Pro packs some nice improvements over the 5 Pro so a price increase of 1000 was expected. But instead, Xiaomi launched it at 1000 less i.e. 13999 which is good pricing. If there was no Realme 2 Pro or Honor 8X then price would have been 15999 for sure. Rating: 9/10.Camera:When Redmi Note 5 Pro launched earlier this year, it had one of the best camera in its price range and now Note 6 Pro comes with an improved camera. The aperture and pixel size has improved which means you are going to see a lot of improvement in low light pictures. In earlier tests, the camera performed well and exceeded our expectations.The front camera now gets a secondary sensor for portrait mode pictures. The performance of front camera is good as well. Pictures looks sharp and colorful with good amount of details. The dynamic range wasn’t great though.The camera is impressive. Few camera samples are included in this review, more samples will be added on the final review on our website. Rating 8.5/10.SummaryOverall, Redmi Note 6 Pro is a well-balanced smartphone at 13999, we think it offers good value for money. If you have a budget of around 15000 and need a phone with good build, good cameras, excellent battery, loud speaker, fast charging then Note 6 Pro should be your choice.If you need a better-looking phone and can compromise with the camera quality and battery backup, then Realme 2 Pro and Honor 8X are good options.If you already have the Note 5 Pro, then you should skip the Note 6 Pro as it is not that big of an upgrade.Which Color is the best?If you like to keep things simple, then go for the Black color. If you need something bright and flashy then go for the Blue color which looks really nice.I hope you liked the review. If it was helpful, please give thumbs-up/upvote.***I purchased this phone on 23rd of December 2017 and writing this review on 15th December 2108. prod_des: The compact and affordable Aqua J1 offers powerful features in a beautifully designed body. In spite of its compact size, it offers a horde of features such as dual-sim capability, a 4.5 cm big display, digital camera, bluetooth, wireless FM etc. One of the biggest highlights of the phone is its 1200 mAh battery, that will last you for days. It's rich multimedia offerings include expandable memory, music and video playback, digital camera, sound recorder, bluetooth, 3.5mm audio jack and fm radio. Besides, you can browse the internet and use in built features to access Facebook. The phone has multi language support, with the user interface being accessible in various Indian languages as well. Overall, this will be a nice, little powerful device that can do much more than you'd probably expect out of it.

Yes after selling my old phone (moto g4 plus - 3 year old for 4k, and instant discount of 1700 and no cost EMI discount of 1500) . For this price I think i got the best deal for such an amazing phone.Delivery: Yes, as promised it was a one day delivery with good packaging. Thank you Amazon.The actual review of the phone:About me: I work as a software engineer who uses all the basic apps one uses on a day to day basis and also I dont play games on mobile phones. So, I dont know how PUBG runs on this device.BUILD: Man, its built like a tank. It just screams premium once you hold it in your hand. You can clearly see the difference between a Chinese phone and a Nokia phone. Its clearly visible. Hats off to Nokia in this department. Actually for the first two weeks I could not get a screen guard and phone cover and I used this phone without them and it fell off from my hands twice, but nothing happened. Not even a scratch. But i recommend buying a cover as the phone is slippery. The best part, even the camera is covered with gorilla glass on the back, so your lens wont have any scratches. There is a YouTube video which shows how nothing happens to this phone even when it falls from 10 feet high. So BUILD: 10/10.BATTERY: When i read the ad which says two day battery life, i was like : this must be a gimmick or marketing strategy. But, i was wrong. The phone indeed gives me a two day battery life with heavy to moderate usage. I keep my mobile data on 24/7 (Airtel 4G). So no complains in this department as well (i dont play games). Screenshot attached of battery usage.SCREEN:  Watching HDR content on this phone is awesome. I watched some Netflix shows on this phone and the contrast levels and blacks were so deep. Auto brightness works as expected. Really a good screen, photos and videos looks great on this device, nothing more to say.CAMERA: Wow, this phone USP is its camera. Really blown away with the picture quality in all conditions. Bokeh mode is very good, low light conditions is good, and with good lighting conditions is even better. Beats oneplus 6t camera. Check YouTube. Attached a sample pic. Really impressed with the camera.PERFORMANCE: Coupled with stock android one software and snapdragon 710, no lags whatsoever enough said.RAM management: Could be improved, i see apps getting refreshed after 20-30 mins of standby. May be owing to 4GB RAM, but guys trust you wont notice any difference or lag. Its good.SOUND: The single speaker at the bottom is good, but it can be easily muted once you have it blocked with a finger. Well, i use the provided headset or my wireless headset. So, no issues for me here.And finally, its an absolute beast. I love this product, worth my money, and I really dont care about the notches. I dont get annoyed by it. I like it, it gives you more screen space. This phone has some software bugs (very minor issues), hope it gets fixed in the Jan security update. Android one phones are best!People who are planning to buy a Oneplus phone : think again, do you need 6GB of RAM? and snap dragon 845 ? This phone has got a better camera and a better build and the RAM and processor are more than enough from a day to day usage point of view, and a better brand of course. So, consider this phone before going for oneplus.Just go for it, you wont regret.***Do not Compare it with Poco F1, Nokia 8.1 shines in its own way.  Buy this, only if have following requirements1) High-quality camera with excellent low light performance2) Premium Design3) Stock Android.4) Good Responsiveness.5) occasional gaming.6) Good Battery backup of nearly 2days on normal use.***After using phone for 5 days my overall opinion is that it is an excellent phone.Pros:1) Snapdragon 710 is very good. No lags even with many apps open.2) display is great.3) Size is appropriate.4) Rear camera is super fast. Click fantastic snaps.5) Android one is good. No bloatware.6) sound quality is very good even with single speaker at bottom.7) Call quality is excellent.However few missess1) Slippery due to glass at back,  need back case.2) Battery lasts one day with 5 -6 h on screen time.3) Front camera need improvements.4) No splash proof (if not IP rating)5) many essential apps such as compass, calculator, GPS, notes, connection speed missing.6) Nokia service centres are not up to the mark in providing quick and satisfactory service.So far so good, Price should be in the range of 21000 to 23000.***1. Touch is smooth but not very smooth. I am using oneplus 6T also which has much smoother touch.2. Battery life is awesome. Screen time is approx 10 hrs for normal use. Standby is close to 5 days.3. Charging is not too fast. It takes 120 mins to charge from 0 to 100 but still very decent.4. Slight heating issues while using camera and shooting long videos.5. Yes it heats up while playing PUBG and any mobile will. Good thing is no lags whatsoever.6. Earphones provided along with the mobile has good sound. They look premium and comfortable to wear.7. It comes with Snapdragon 710. Performance is good though you cant compare with Snapdragon 845 processor. OnePlus 6T is superfast.8. Camera is unbeatable. Very very good. Beats oneplus easily. Front camera shows real colour and images are sharp and same is true for Rear camera.9. Very durable. Awesome build quality. But the back glass is not scratch resistant. It easily get minor scratches.10. Back surface is slippery so you definitely need a case or cover.11. Back glass is a finger magnet.12. Usb type c cord is about 1 meter long.13. Speakers are okay. Not too attractive. Loud enough to use it in bathroom.14. No I dont recommend this phone at a price point of Rs 27000. Its price should not be around Rs 20000.15. No face unlock feature yet.16. If you use two sims, battery backup will be reduced by 35 percent.17. Metal paint on the sides is chipping off in 8 days of usage. So get a cover asap.***Waited more than a month to get this here in India and it's been worth it.Pros:1) Awesome display (better than op6).2) Great battery life (1 day plus with heavy usage).3) Flawless build quality and design.4) Camera is excellent in daylight. Good in low light as well if you use flash.5) No real difference in performance in day to day usage compared to OP 6.6) Call quality is excellent.7) While the speaker's positioning could have been better, it is quite loud.8) The in box earphones are one of the most comfortable I've ever used and can get very loud.9) Android one.10) Colorado: Iron/Silver is amazing.Cons:1) It's not a Nokia thing but an Android pie thing, the home/recent button being the same is a little frustrating.Overall, I'm glad I waited for it :D***

You can also be rest assured about the quality of the device as all Aqua phones and their accessories are quality certified by the Bureau of India Standards. Aqua offers a standard 1 year warranty on its handsets and 6 months warranty on in-box accessories. Whether you want to use it as your main phone, your secondary handset or gift it to your loved ones, this is your perfect choice. You will be more than delighted to own this beauty!

Product_name: Panasonic Single Line 2.4GHz KX-TG3611SX Digital Cordless Telephone
feature: Cordless phone with caller ID and speakerphone2.4GHz frequency support, AAA NI-MH battery providing talk-time of 5 hours and standby time of 264 hours50 phonebook entries and 5 redial memoryAlphanumeric backlight display with alphanumeric keypad and night mode, Both KX-TG3611SXB and KX-TG3611SX are the same B represents the color of the TelephoneWall mountable phone, clock, alarm, any key answer, wheel navigation keys, light-up indicator with ringer alert, digital security code, paging and 7 ringer patterns, speakerphone
cust_review: I purchased a Panasonic Single Line 2.4GHz KX-TG3611SX Digital Cordless Telephone from the seller Target A2Z through Amazon. The packaging of the product was nice and as per Amazon advt. The product was in a sealed pack and new one. I received a handset, base station, charging adapter and 2 nos. rechargeable AAA cells along with a operation manual and  a bill. There was no signed warranty card inside from the seller. Regarding the quality of the product, it is still working fine after constant use of last 60 days. The sound quality is fine. There is a speaker phone mode, though the sound is not that loud. There is no backlit display on the dialpad. The range is very good and easily covering my whole villa of 2500 Sq. Ft. without diminishing the quality. There is no interference with adjacent modem or other electronic gadgets around on the voice quality. But the base station must be always connected to power line, most preferably to UPS, otherwise there will be no incoming or outgoing call even if the handset runs on rechargeable batteries. There is no requirement of always keeping the handset connected to base station while not in use. The handset runs 48 hrs even if u don't charge it. For the first time use, u need to charge it for 7 hrs minimum. The display LED is clear and shows the incoming and outgoing calls. Phonebook software is very low grade and not much user friendly. There is a call and charging alert LED on top of the handset. The ringtones are not that loud and may not be audible from distance. The handset and the base station should be kept away from dust, otherwise it creates trouble in charging. Charging connectors must be kept clean. Another big issue is the after sales service. There are a very few service centres of Panasonic authorised for handset service. The common service centres of Panasonic for TV, refrigerators etc. in your city won't entertain complaint for the cordless handset if any. So, be mentally prepared beforehand if you are NOT residing in major metro cities. The phone overall performance is good till now as expected from a low budget cordless phone. But regarding after sales service do not expect much as support.***The range I pathetic! its a very very very bad product. I would suggest not wasting your money on this. It does not even give a proper range of 10 feet! its not really cordless if you are unable to talk from anywhere you want. Standing next the receiver hardly qualifies as cordless. Its a joke!***Beware! This phone literally doesn't work without electric supply despite having batteries. It's like having a nice cordless landline which turns into a dead-phone when there is a power cut at home. Here are some drawbacks that made me send the product back: (1) display light cannot be controlled and is lit for only 5 - 10 seconds, (2) ringer volume isn't that great, (3) speaker is not loud enough as you would expect, (4) the battery charge drains very quickly, (end). And yeah, the only cool thing about this phone is the Sci-Fi sound that it makes when you're on a call with someone and the power gets cut. I bet you'll like it.***I am reviewing this product after 2 years of use . Even today it is working fine and no problem encountered so far.Sound quality - clear and crispNetwork quality -greatBattery backup - Average ,not that greatFunction/Features - not too many features , have only some basic features ,like that time setting , save contract numbers up to 100  ,10 types of ringtone etc .It’s receiver doesn’t not have any battery backup this works only if power supply continue. So  plug it in socket that have inverter supply .MY OVERALL RATING FOR THIS PHONE IS 7.5 OUT OF 10***This is an ok product , not a great one .I purchased it because we live in a duplex house and the base station is at the ground floor while parent live on the first floor. The overall build quality of the product is good and the has decent battery life but there are some issues .If you have older people in the house , and they will primarily use this , then this is not a good choice as the audio from the headset is NOT LOUD ENOUGH , so older people will have trouble understanding what is being said without turning on the hands free loudspeaker mode.Similarly the the fonts on the LCD display are too small for senior citizens to read .buy only if the primary users have young sharp ears and good eyesight.***Best for making your landline wireless.Has good range.Battery lasts upto a day without rechargingNo need wasting money buying other costly wireless handsets.This does the job, that too elegantly.Have been using for almost 2 years now***Purchased this product but after 1month the battery doesn't fully charge spite of charging it whole night, it will show 3 bars in the display but once u lift it it will show 1 bar asking to reconnect to the base for charging.... The voice quality is good when we purchased, only issue is with the charging. May be I have been give a bad battery.***Great product. sound quality and voice quality both are good. I am living in a 2 BHK flat so ringing bell and range is also not a problem for me.P.S. I am sharing this review after one month of purchasing this product.***

cust_review: After using a smartphone for a little too many days and being stuck in constant distractions, I've traded in my smartphone for this dumb phone, and I've been so happy with this decision. The OS is simple and lag free, basic functions like the camera and music player work as expected. The music player is a little too bare-bones for my liking but it's still passable at this price. Call quality is good, battery life is pretty good as well, and it recognises 4G sim cards albeit it doesn't really support 4G call quality or even the internet!Overall this phone is great for minimalists, the elderly, or really anyone looking for a digital detox.***I bought if for my father and from next day on wards it is automatically switching off in every 4-5 minutes. He could not use it and is very upset and frustrated. We have place the order to replace it.  I feel the old NOKIA is no more....that quality gone. I will recommend not to buy it.***OK if all you want is a basic feature phone for voice calls and messaging. Voice quality is not really great - so may not be useful for seniors. Phone finish and looks are average.***I chose Nokia over others for simple UI, its durability, quality and battery backup based on  performance of my old Nokia basic phones which even today are functioning without any flaws. But since Nokia has handed over its  handset production  to HMD global the quality of Nokia products especially feature phones have declined. This product Nokia 150 disappoints in every aspect like battery backup (3-4 days max in standby and 2 days if you do some calling and  play music ),camera quality(even  jiophone has better quality ,Nokia 150 will capture ghost out of you) and every thing for which i purchased it. At same or cheaper price other companies are offering better features like inbuilt call recorder , 3000mah battery with power bank feature. what is use of durability when performance is poor. Go for Samsung if you are using 2G network or better go for jiophone (which i have tried and tested).Regarding the  seller i.e Appario retail, they didn't mention any of the two IMEI Numbers without  which warranty can't be claimed instead they have mentioned  one IMEI number in 'order summary' where it has been clearly written that it can not be presented as an invoice. Powered by pure, secure and up-to-date Android 9 Pie.
feature: 12MP+13MP ZEISS dual rear camera with 1/2.55-inch, 1.4um, OIS, EIS, ZEISS, 2PD, dual Hi-Cri flash and FF depth sensing | 20MP front camera15.6 centimeters (6.18-inch) FHD+ capacitive touchscreen with 1080 x 2246 pixels resolutionMemory, Storage and SIM: 4GB RAM | 64GB internal memory expandable up to 400GB | Dual SIM (nano+nano) dual-standby (4G+4G)Android v9 Pie operating system with 2.2GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 710 octa core processor3500mAH lithium-ion battery with adaptive battery feature for longer life1 year manufacturer warranty for device and 6 months manufacturer warranty for in-box accessories including batteries from the date of purchaseThanks to HDR10 support, 96% color gamut and 1:1500 contrast ratio, you can enjoy brighter videos with crisper details and richer colors
cust_review: Writing this review after 1 month of usage. Got delivered on 24th December 2018.First let me tell you about the pricing and amazon delivery:Pricing:I got this phone for around 20K INR. Yes after selling my old phone (moto g4 plus - 3 year old for 4k, and instant discount of 1700 and no cost EMI discount of 1500) . For this price I think i got the best deal for such an amazing phone.Delivery: Yes, as promised it was a one day delivery with good packaging. Thank you Amazon.The actual review of the phone:About me: I work as a software engineer who uses all the basic apps one uses on a day to day basis and also I dont play games on mobile phones. So, I dont know how PUBG runs on this device.BUILD: Man, its built like a tank. It just screams premium once you hold it in your hand. You can clearly see the difference between a Chinese phone and a Nokia phone. Its clearly visible. Hats off to Nokia in this department. Actually for the first two weeks I could not get a screen guard and phone cover and I used this phone without them and it fell off from my hands twice, but nothing happened. Not even a scratch. But i recommend buying a cover as the phone is slippery. The best part, even the camera is covered with gorilla glass on the back, so your lens wont have any scratches. There is a YouTube video which shows how nothing happens to this phone even when it falls from 10 feet high. So BUILD: 10/10.BATTERY: When i read the ad which says two day battery life, i was like : this must be a gimmick or marketing strategy. But, i was wrong. The phone indeed gives me a two day battery life with heavy to moderate usage. I keep my mobile data on 24/7 (Airtel 4G). So no complains in this department as well (i dont play games). Screenshot attached of battery usage.SCREEN:  Watching HDR content on this phone is awesome. I watched some Netflix shows on this phone and the contrast levels and blacks were so deep. Auto brightness works as expected. Really a good screen, photos and videos looks great on this device, nothing more to say.CAMERA: Wow, this phone USP is its camera. Really blown away with the picture quality in all conditions. Bokeh mode is very good, low light conditions is good, and with good lighting conditions is even better. Beats oneplus 6t camera. Check YouTube. Attached a sample pic. Really impressed with the camera.PERFORMANCE: Coupled with stock android one software and snapdragon 710, no lags whatsoever enough said.RAM management: Could be improved, i see apps getting refreshed after 20-30 mins of standby. May be owing to 4GB RAM, but guys trust you wont notice any difference or lag. Its good.SOUND: The single speaker at the bottom is good, but it can be easily muted once you have it blocked with a finger. Well, i use the provided headset or my wireless headset. So, no issues for me here.And finally, its an absolute beast. I love this product, worth my money, and I really dont care about the notches. I dont get annoyed by it. I like it, it gives you more screen space. This phone has some software bugs (very minor issues), hope it gets fixed in the Jan security update. Android one phones are best!People who are planning to buy a Oneplus phone : think again, do you need 6GB of RAM? and snap dragon 845 ? This phone has got a better camera and a better build and the RAM and processor are more than enough from a day to day usage point of view, and a better brand of course. So, consider this phone before going for oneplus.Just go for it, you wont regret.***Do not Compare it with Poco F1, Nokia 8.1 shines in its own way.  Buy this, only if have following requirements1) High-quality camera with excellent low light performance2) Premium Design3) Stock Android.4) Good Responsiveness.5) occasional gaming.6) Good Battery backup of nearly 2days on normal use.***After using phone for 5 days my overall opinion is that it is an excellent phone.Pros:1) Snapdragon 710 is very good. No lags even with many apps open.2) display is great.3) Size is appropriate.4) Rear camera is super fast. Click fantastic snaps.5) Android one is good. No bloatware.6) sound quality is very good even with single speaker at bottom.7) Call quality is excellent.However few missess1) Slippery due to glass at back,  need back case.2) Battery lasts one day with 5 -6 h on screen time.3) Front camera need improvements.4) No splash proof (if not IP rating)5) many essential apps such as compass, calculator, GPS, notes, connection speed missing.6) Nokia service centres are not up to the mark in providing quick and satisfactory service.So far so good, Price should be in the range of 21000 to 23000.***1. Touch is smooth but not very smooth. I am using oneplus 6T also which has much smoother touch.2. Battery life is awesome. Screen time is approx 10 hrs for normal use. Standby is close to 5 days.3. Charging is not too fast. It takes 120 mins to charge from 0 to 100 but still very decent.4. Slight heating issues while using camera and shooting long videos.5. Yes it heats up while playing PUBG and any mobile will. Good thing is no lags whatsoever.6. Earphones provided along with the mobile has good sound. They look premium and comfortable to wear.7. It comes with Snapdragon 710. Performance is good though you cant compare with Snapdragon 845 processor. OnePlus 6T is superfast.8. Camera is unbeatable. Very very good. Beats oneplus easily. Front camera shows real colour and images are sharp and same is true for Rear camera.9. Very durable. Awesome build quality. But the back glass is not scratch resistant. It easily get minor scratches.10. Back surface is slippery so you definitely need a case or cover.11. Back glass is a finger magnet.12. Usb type c cord is about 1 meter long.13. Speakers are okay. Not too attractive. Loud enough to use it in bathroom.14. No I dont recommend this phone at a price point of Rs 27000. Its price should not be around Rs 20000.15. No face unlock feature yet.16. If you use two sims, battery backup will be reduced by 35 percent.17. Metal paint on the sides is chipping off in 8 days of usage. So get a cover asap.***Waited more than a month to get this here in India and it's been worth it.Pros:1) Awesome display (better than op6).2) Great battery life (1 day plus with heavy usage).3) Flawless build quality and design.4) Camera is excellent in daylight. Good in low light as well if you use flash.5) No real difference in performance in day to day usage compared to OP 6.6) Call quality is excellent.7) While the speaker's positioning could have been better, it is quite loud.8) The in box earphones are one of the most comfortable I've ever used and can get very loud.9) Android one.10) Colorado: Iron/Silver is amazing.Cons:1) It's not a Nokia thing but an Android pie thing, the home/recent button being the same is a little frustrating.Overall, I'm glad I waited for it :D***

prod_des: Be it at home or the workplace, landline phones are quite a necessity. Even though mobile technology has had a widespread impact as far as telecommunication is concerned, landline phones have continued to serve as dependable tools of telecommunication, from the domestic sphere to the professional. The Panasonic Kxtg-3711Sxn Cordless landline phone is one such phone which is dependable and is laden with features that complement the diverse needs and meet the dynamic purposes that communication comprises of in these times. With easy dialling features and a robust, ergonomic make that promotes easy handling, this cordless landline phone would be a prudent choice, if you have been looking for one. Cordless phones-The Panasonic Kxtg-3711Sxn Cordless landline phone has a cordless make. The handset can be carried around freely and this availability of space while talking on the phone induces a feeling of free movement, which is appreciable. It has a wide working range from the base unit and is capable of providing crystal clear undisturbed signal within that range. Memory-This Panasonic Kxtg-3711Sxn Cordless landline phone is equipped with a phone book memory capable of saving 100 names and numbers. The call log memory allows the storage of 50 numbers. Caller identification and handsfree feature Design and colour - Complete with a modern and sleek look, the phone looks stellar. It has a white make which looks stunning. The wall-mountable make of the base unit not only adds much to its look, but also improves accessibility and handling, thereby adding on to utility features.
feature: Cordless phone with caller IDRechargeable NI-MH batteryCaller ID with 50 name and number memoryLarge 1.8-inch LCD displayWall mountable phone
cust_review: Was looking for a cordless phone with good battery back-up, as well as ability to mute the conversation or converse using speaker - both of which were very important to me for taking official calls. After a lot of research of different models across brands, found this to be the optimal choice within the price range around INR2.5K.Has multiple other useful features too like Locator, Intercom, Call Waiting, Phonebook, Polyphonic Ringtones etc. Definitely recommended if you want to use cordless phone for home & office calls.***Used for 2. months they product is good sound quality is good battery life and range is also good but my device is not charging and is powered off. I can also see rusting sign in charging stations ...Surprised about life of Panasonic .. never thought it needed help in 2 month.Kindly help.Thanks***This cordless phone works on 2.4Ghz frequency which is the same as WiFi routers. So, the signal interference is very high and hence the voice quality is very poor***Very disappointing quality. Bought on 23 Sep 2016 and within 4 months the display is completely gone. This unit was made in Panasonic India and reflects on total lack of quality and reliability systems in the Panasonic India factory. I had previously used a cordless phone made in Panasonic Japan without any performance or reliability problems for 10 years.Avoid this product and be wary of any product from Panasonic India.***Whilst it offered everything which was depicted on Amazon, it lacks auto hang up mode. In case you receive a call and forget to press hang up button , the line will remain engaged until it is hung up . This is a deal breaker . Should disconnect on its own once call ends .***I bought this set in May and it doesn't work anymore. Screen shows check phone line all the time without a dialtone. Whereas the line os absolutely fine. Other phone instruments are working fine on the same line. Very sad to see amazon selling poor quality stuff online. I would like to know if this instrument is covered under warranty. Its only 2 months since i am using it. I would like to avail my right for warranty.***Product is good, I gave gift to my wife. After bought it mostly avoid the mobile phone, I preferred my wife safety. If use long time no harm for health.After few years I face some charging problem, I spoke with customer care, they don't give service to doorstep, we have to take to secunderabad for service, finally we found the solution.***The cordless phones has a premium feel to it. U can save upto 100 contacts though searching a contact feature would be great. No disturbence due to 2.4ghz modem or TV which resides close to the device. Decent range. Locator n cordless speaker feature really comes in handy.A good budget cordless phone***

cust_review: I am a fitness freak so daily go to a morning walk and a 1.5km run on a round ground. As we all use our mobile phones daily and we need our songs calls and many people uses for km ,time taken, calories burnt etc but the main thing is where should we keep our cell phones its not always to carry a bag while running or to keep the phone in shorts pocket as it starts jumping in shorts or track pant pocket so i got a thought to buy this pouch.The following are points I observed after using 3 days while running:-* The pouch is soft so that it doest hurt our skin while running or any kind of rubbibg with pouch.* The pouch strip which grips the phone pouch with our arm is good enough to hold if any big jerk met us while running.* The pouch is big enough to have my nokia 6.1 plus which is 5.8" screen and as per specification it can hold 6.3" inches.* The pouch has one more pocket to carry your cash money ,card or house keys.* The pouch's fabric is good enough that it doesnt make you sweat in your arm while running .* I havnt checked for waterproofing effect but yes my sweat doesnt touch my phones and my cash money.* As now carrying phone becomes easy so i have started running more without think much about phones safety.*********************************Verdict :- On an average we have our phone costs around 10k - 20k and I bought this pouch at 499 bucks. If you think i have wasted my money, No i have invested in the safety of my phone ,as if the local pouch looses its grip and my phone breaks down then i have to buy a new one which is then called as a wastage of money.***i personally recommend this product . its quality is very good ,it is sturdy , do not move while running,you can easily put your phone and money in it. It even has a small hole for you headphones ,if you go for morning walk/Jogging this product  is definately usefull to you***Its a Solid product and doesn't move as you run .Its stays intact even if u run faster also it has other pockets to keep some cash and card and without having to carry a wallet while u jog.***I chose this because it is made of neoprene. Neoprene has fair amount of elasticity compared to nylon and hence it will hold the phone tight. This pouch will be suitable for few sizes of phones.  The main pouch accommodated Asus 5.5 inches with Armor Cover and the secondary pouch held HTC M8 also with Armor cover. Neoprene is easily washable. Good finishing and strong Velcro. Pics attached. Recommended.***This is a suitable product for tech geeks andfor those who participates in outdoor activities. It can perfectly hold my "Honor 9 lite" and some of my other stuff like cards and earphones as well as my powerbank. It can also be used as a hard drive cover. I hope this review will help u all in making a right decision.***Loved the fitting of the band and it is very spacious. It has space for money, keys, phone, etc. It doesn't slip off the hand it stays put. The quality is very nice too.***This is an extremely useful and Handy Arm Band Holder. Much better than it's pictures, the quality of this pouch is too good. It is sturdy, water resistant and you can now carry your phone, iPods, keys, money on the go while you jog or travel around.It's very comfortable to wear and can easily adjust on your arms. It is a value for money product and a must buy for carefree fitness on the go.***This mobile case is very handy and usefull while jogging.Few weeks i has started jogging and was difficult to carry phone ,keys or a little cash but this pouch made my life very easy.I can easily carry my phone and other stuff.Its even water proof and made from very good quality material.It fitts very easily in my arm so its easy to carry***

However after the software updated ,there was a technical glitch. The entire screen went into a black-and-white screen and it was not possible to reverse it with the regular settings. Had to reset the phone with factory reset. This entire process took 4 to 5 hours and this was a bitter experience. The powerful 8MP front and 13MP rear camera with F1.9 aperture, push you to turn moments into crisper, more natural and richly detailed photos, day or night. The all-new Chat-Over-Video feature allows you to use popular messaging apps without having to pause or resize your video. The transparent keyboard ensures your video viewing is not hampered so you can enjoy an uninterrupted viewing experience. Go on, binge and chat or chat and binge, non-stop. cust_review: First of all, i did not buy this phone for the purpose of phone actually.  This is more for the personal sim which is linked to my Aadhar/Bank accounts/Gas/Electricity/School etc.  hence I wanted a phone that would not require frequent charging and be on always to receive all messages.  This phone is just too good for that with its big battery.Here are the impressions after its usage.Pros:Very stylish and rugged looking phone.Good battery life (3600 mah).Good music output (clarity and volume is also good)Nice torch with a dedicated button for it.Large keypad displayFM is good as it can tune into stations with better clarity than my smartphone.They say it as "easy fm" but it still needs the headphones to be inserted.  Not wireless FM.Has a USB power out hence can be used a power bank if requiredSupports SD card upto 32 GB for all the music you need.Also because of the USB cable support, you can connect it to the computer and do the file transfer/editing etc realtimeTriple sim facility with dedicated button for easy sim selection (i have used only one sim)consWhile every thing else is loud on this phone (ringtone, sms ringtone, fm, music player) the call volume is not that loud.  I am sure you will have trouble in having a conversation out in the busy/noisy streets.Though it has a front and rear camera, both are useless to say the least as in this age of smartphone cameras, this output will not leave anyone satisfied.I used the powerbank feature once and felt the battery was draining out fast hence do not recommend this as a powerbank substitute.  In an emergency, it will double up as one.It is heavy as it is bulky.  Cannot carry it in the shirt pocket.To remove the battery or insert a sim / sd card you would need to carry its tool to screw and unscrew the cover. If ever the phone goes into a hang, and you would need to remove the battery then it would be a pain without the screwdriver.Phone book has a memory of 500 numbers only.  Then you will have to store it in the sim/s.No great choice of default ringtones/alarm***MERITS:sound is awsom..torch light is awsom..battery backup is awsom..speed is awsome...less price..easy button..DEMERITS:big size..weight is hight..slow internet ..overall satisfied..***Good product long lasting battery***The product is not as per the image that I saw. In the image the brand name shows as MIDO and actually it is Kechaoda. The size of the phone is comparatively too big then the image. There are 4 screws to open the back panel to put the 3 SIM and the battery. The body of phone is literally made up of plastic, cheap plastic. The colour of the phone is nice and the torch output is too good and this sound quality is pretty awesome..you can also charge ur another Android phone because it has a power bank which is good***Heavier and it's so bulky not slim as shown in the picture***No good***It's good***Product is ok for the money paid.***

Un-bezel your imagination. The fluid body is wrapped with smooth curves for a virtually continuous screen. The placement of finger-print sensor at the back gives you a comfortable grip and wider playing field to enjoy movies and games. So, it’s only bound to unlimit your experience. Reinvent the way you shop with Samsung Mall. Just snap anything you wish to own and be ready to grab it. The unique AI-powered visual search shows you endless options across popular online platforms. So, just shoot it and shop it, instantly. Defy the norms and stun everyone with your incredible shots. The powerful 8MP front and 13MP rear camera with F1.9 aperture, push you to turn moments into crisper, more natural and richly detailed photos, day or night. Unlock your phone in the fastest and coolest way with Face Recognition. The advanced front camera is more than just a camera. It helps ensure your phone is secure so your content remains private. After all, why just limit your face to selfies? Entertainment has no boundaries now. The all-new Chat-Over-Video feature allows you to use popular messaging apps without having to pause or resize your video. The transparent keyboard ensures your video viewing is not hampered so you can enjoy an uninterrupted viewing experience. Go on, binge and chat or chat and binge, non-stop. Set new records with the speed you’ve always wished for. The latest operating system - Android O, coupled with next-gen processor, 4GB RAM and 64GB, memory lets you multitask as fast as you can.
